1:
A declaration about the Valley of Vision:\q1 What is the reason that you have all gone up to the housetops?
\q1
2:
Is it so you may hear a city full of noises, a town full of revelry?\q1 Your dead were not killed with the sword, and they did not die in battle.


\q1
3:
All your rulers fled away together, but they were captured without using a bow;\q1 all of them were captured together, though they had fled far away.
\q1
4:
Therefore I said, "Do not look at me, I will weep bitterly;\q1 do not try to comfort me concerning the destruction of the daughter of my people."


\q1
5:
For there is a day of tumult, treading down, and confusion for the Lord Yahweh of hosts,\q1 in the Valley of Vision, a breaking down of the walls, and people crying out to the mountains.
\q1
6:
Elam takes up the quiver, with chariots of men and horsemen,\q1 and Kir lays the shield bare.
\q1
7:
It will come about that your choicest valleys\q1 will be full of chariots, and the horsemen will take their positions at the gate.


\q1
8:
He took away the protection of Judah;\q1 and you looked in that day to the weapons in the Palace of the Forest.
\q1
9:
You saw the breaches of the city of David, that they were many,\q1 and you collected the water of the lower pool.


\q1
10: You counted the houses of Jerusalem, and you tore down the houses to strengthen the wall.\q1
11:
You made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool.\q1 But you did not consider the city's maker, who had planned it long ago.


\q1
12:
The Lord Yahweh of hosts called on that day\q1 for weeping, for mourning, for shaved heads, and the wearing of sackcloth.
\q1
13:
But look, instead, celebration and gladness, killing cattle and slaughtering sheep,\q1 eating meat and drinking wine; let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we will die.
\q1
14:
This was revealed in my ears by Yahweh of hosts:\q1 "Surely this iniquity will not be forgiven you, even when you die," says the Lord Yahweh of hosts.


\q1
15: The Lord Yahweh of hosts, says this, "Go to this administrator, to Shebna, who is over the house, and say,\q1
16:
'What are you doing here and who gave you permission to cut out a tomb for yourself,\q1 hewing out a grave on the heights and carving out a resting place in the rock?'"


\q1
17: See, Yahweh is about to throw you, a mighty man, about to throw you down; he will grasp you tightly.\q1
18:
He will surely wind you round and round, and toss you like a ball into a vast country.\q1 There you will die, and there your glorious chariots will be; you will be the shame of your master's house!
\q1
19:
"I will thrust you from your office and from your station. You will be pulled down.

\q1
20: It will come about on that day that I will call my servant Eliakim son of Hilkiah.\q1
21:
I will clothe him with your tunic and put on him your sash, and I will transfer your authority into his hand.\q1 He will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the house of Judah.
\q1
22:
I will place the key of the house of David on his shoulder;\q1 he will open, and none will shut; he will shut, and none will open.


\q1
23:
I will fasten him, a peg in a secure place,\q1 and he will become a seat of glory for his father's house.
\q1
24: They will hang on him all the glory of his father's house, the offspring and descendants, every small container \q1 from the cups to all the jugs.
25: On that day—this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts—the peg driven in a firm place will give way, break off, and fall, and the weight that was on it will be cut off—for Yahweh has spoken.
